channel.title: Regarding the MITB hack
channel.description:
I was checking some logs over at villavu.com today and found that someone did a similar hack on villavu.com forums. (E: Including, most likely - a database dump)
While the hackers used tor in most cases, Nielsie95 and I managed to find a few IP's that are definitely from the hack, but aren't using tor.
Facts:
[ul][*] After the initial hack, the account "super_" was given lots of access, and a reputation power of 13k+. [*] One of the IP's used in the AdminCP match super_'s IRC logins. ( https://encrypted.google.com/search?q=pool-173-65-194-148.tampfl.fios.verizon.net ) [*] One of my fellow admins' password was somehow retrieved, used to access the admincp. Apparently the HTTP auth (extra auth) was also compromised, perhaps the password of the admin was the same - this seems like the only possibility. After that, he changed the password of an admin with access to vBulletin plugins (the account was unfortunately mutable) (the ones where you can edit php code of plugins... directly in the admincp). After that a simple shell script was edited into the plugin.[/ul]
E: This all took place 3 and 4 September.

item.title: Regarding the MITB hack
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:64, topic:414033”][quote author=Wizzup? link=topic=515997.msg3748072#msg3748072 date=1315819381]
Mopar, I can only assume his VPN'' _must_ have logged the IP of hisfriend’’? That would help if he is telling the truth.
[/quote]

I asked him that of course, but after this guy used his VPN to do bad stuff, he immediately un-installed it which got rid of all the logs. Again, it’s all very convenient[/quote]

As far as I know uninstalling programs does not get rid of the logs. Not on Debian family, not on RedHat/Fedora family, not on Gentoo. I never really believed it was super_, but I think this is too fishy. There must be some way he can retrieve the IP or some information about this guy surely.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:66, topic:414033”]I think it’s probably more likely he is just trying to take credit for something he didn’t do. From my years of doing this, whenever something like this happens people seem to come out of the woodwork to try and take credit for it.[/quote]That doesn’t explain how he got my password or how he knew where the shell was on my site, or why the perpetrator of my account did things that only TX had threatened to do…

EDIT - Or why the IP that logged into my account matched TX’s (Jme can confirm, I also had him check on the IRC). Unless I’m misunderstanding your point?

item.title: Regarding the MITB hack
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“WT-Fakawi, post:48, topic:414033”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=515997.msg3747180#msg3747180 date=1315772705]
super_ didn’t ‘tattle’ or ‘snitch’ until I confronted him with irrefutable evidence that he was the one that did all of this. For all I know, he made up this ridiculous story about a ‘friend’ and a VPN.
[/quote] It is always a ridiculous story…a friend, a brother, a virus, I left my door open. Heard many, believed none. Meanwhile, seems that all our hard work for the past 7 years has been stolen. I am consulting our lawyers to see if it is a criminal offence and whether it is possible to legally nail the offenders.[/quote]

The problem being how to find the offenders and prove it?

Wizzup?:

Mopar, I can only assume his VPN'' _must_ have logged the IP of hisfriend’’? That would help if he is telling the truth.

I asked him that of course, but after this guy used his VPN to do bad stuff, he immediately un-installed it which got rid of all the logs. Again, it’s all very convenient.

@Davidi2, but that guy says he got into my server with an ‘SMF exploit’ when he clearly didn’t, he just used Mopman’s password. So I’m not so sure it was that guy.

Read full topic

item.title: Regarding the MITB hack
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Greeny, normally I respect you and your ability to debate and back your opinion up with facts but as it stands I’ve never seen anybody as ignorant as you are being in this thread. There have been zero blind accusations, as I previously stated and as Davids last post demonstrates. As for evidence against kevin, I fail to see how IRC logs can not be seen as evidence. Perhaps if someone other then a trusted member such as MITB or David were to post them it would be possible that they were faked but as it stands I seriously doubt they would go to the trouble of faking logs just to provide proof.

As for Moparisthebest dealing with this without any input from the user base that is laughable. It was our passwords that were compromised and therefore our input is obviously important. Not to mention that some people here have valuable information to shed light on (see: David).

I don't care, I just wanted this thread to be a legible source of information for MITB regarding the hack..

By adding our input, backed with evidence, we have provided mitb with a very ‘legible’ source of information for mitb to go over. Without davids post he might never have discovered that it could have been T__X (regardless of if it was him or not he can now check into it).

As it stands, every post you’ve made here has been completely invalid and yet your ignorant enough to believe that you’ve been right the entire time.

Read full topic

RSCUn = RSC Underworld = The server owned and developed by TX
He showed me my password (that I only used here and my site), showed me where the shell script was (where the code matched with that Wizzup gave), and like I said nobody else would give a shit about my site, would they? That’s the proof I have against TX. The only proof I have that it’s related to this would be they happened within a few days of eachother, the shell scripts match exactly, the password only matched the one from this sites database, and the same process was used to put the code into my site. Call it blind if you wish, I honestly don’t know what’s going on here.
